title: Pollsters can't agree how far ahead the Conservatives are - and shy Labour voters could be to blame
text:
Most people who follow politics in the UK would be familiar with the concept of shy Tories - people who have voted Conservative in the past or intend to in the future, but who feel uneasy about admitting it.

However, the currently high level of volatility in the UK's polling landscape could actually be down to a shy Labour vote, according to a leading polling expert.

Since Boris Johnson became Prime Minister, most major polling companies have consistently put the Conservatives ahead of Labour. But there is widespread disagreement on just how large this gap really is.
